file_content.text: Great work. Pleasure working with you.
Used to be we kept the resistance in check in the wilds, but now they've started to get bolder. They're attacking Imperial holdings in the old Balmorran industrial area.
We need to punish their boldness. Lieutenant Thorpe at Markaran Outpost has some ideas about how to put the resistance back in their place.
Great work. Lieutenant Thorpe is in charge of phase two. He's at the Markaran Imperial Outpost.
Must've been imagining things, but I could've sworn I heard those generators go "pop" from here.
Thank you, my lord, but it looks like the resistance isn't done yet.
Good work, but it looks like the resistance isn't done yet.
You'd think the Empire would have an easier time with a rag-tag bunch of resistance fighters.
What's gone wrong now?
I should think blowing up their guns leaves little room for misunderstanding.
Won't they learn?
They're a stubborn bunch.
I will hunt down each and every member of the resistance if I have to.
I'll take care of it.
Good to hear you say it.
We need those generators in Neebray Warehouse destroyed.
Phase one of Operation Breaking Point is to destroy those generators and put those killers to sleep. You in?
I signed up to serve the Empire, and I intend to do it.
I told the captain I'd help.
From the looks of you, I'd say you mean it.
Sure.
Why not?
You find the time, you rain death.
The generators are in the Neebray Warehouse. If you can blow them to pieces, you'll show the Balmorran resistance it takes more than cold-blooded killers to stop the Empire.
My lord, word of your talent precedes you. I'm honored.
You're well aware of the situation I'm sure.
The government-in-exile, the resistance: cowards. If my lord is willing, we're going to bury them in their little hidey-holes.
Agent, I hope you're tough. I hope you like to get dirty.
Hunter, you look like a man who's seen blood. Good.
Hunter, you look like a woman who's seen blood. Good.
I heard Captain Rigel was sending someone my way. Pleased to meet you.
The battle for Balmorra can only be won with blood, sweat and tears: our sweat, their blood and tears.
The government-in-exile, the resistance: cowards. We're going to bury them in their little hidey-holes.
What's war without a little bloodshed?
Sounds perfect.
I like how you think.
Fill me in.
Yes, I get it. We're going to crush the resistance. What's your point?
Cut to the chase.
The old government's sending generators to the resistance, powering their artillery. The resistance has given pardons to Balmorra's worst killers in exchange for a little guard duty.
War. Beautiful, isn't it?
